esp8266.init:
Initialize ESP8266 module. The serial port and generic settings.
First connects to the module, using 9600 baud, 8N1 and sets explicit
target settings and resets the module.
esp8266.init|param|rate: the new baud rate, eg: BaudRate.BaudRate115200
esp8266.init|param|rx: the new reception pin, eg: SerialPin.C16
esp8266.init|param|tx: the new transmission pins, eg: SerialPin.C17
esp8266.isAttached: Check if we are attached to the wifi network.
esp8266.sendOk:
Check if the last send operation was successful.
Also reset the status.
modem:
Modem functionality to send and received AT commands and responses.
* @author Matthias L. Jugel
modem.expectOK:
Send an AT command to the modem module and expect OK. Just provide the actual
command, not the AT prefix, like this AT("+CGMI?"). This function
only returns whether the command was executed successful or not.
modem.expectOK|param|command: the command to be sent without AT prefix
modem.pushAT:
Send an AT command to the modem module. Just provide the actual
command, not the AT prefix, like this AT("+CGMI?"). Ignores the
AT command response completely
modem.pushAT|param|command: the command to be sent without AT prefix
serial:
Reading and writing data over a serial connection.

Extensions to the serial module.
* @author Matthias L. Jugel
serial.setReceiveBufferSize|param|size: the new size of the receive buffer, eg: 20
